NAME: easterday
DESCRIPTION: This dataset consists in the sound inventory part of [Easterday's (2019)](:bib:Easterday2019) study of complex syllable structures.

NAME: aus
DESCRIPTION: This dataset is taken from a list of phoneme frequencies in the lexicons of 166 language varieties of Australia published by [Macklin-Cordes and Round (2020)](:bib:MacklinCordes2020).

NAME: allenbai
DESCRIPTION: This dataset was taken from the description of several Bai dialect varieties by [Allen (2007)](:bib:Allen2007). All sound segments were extracted from the original source and then mapped to the CLTS system. The detailed phoneme inventories per language as well as the lexical data reported in the same source are available in the form of a [CLDF dataset](https://github.com/lexibank/allenbai).

NAME: apics
DESCRIPTION: This is the segmental data provided by the [Atlas of Pidgin and Creole Language Structures Online](http://apics-online.info/).

NAME: art
DESCRIPTION: A numeric account of sonority based on LingPy as presented in List (2014) and List et al. (2017)

NAME: asjp
DESCRIPTION: Sound class model (produced in a semi-generative manner with help of LingPy) following the ASJP (Wichmann et al. 2016) as used in List (2014).

NAME: asjpcode
DESCRIPTION: Transcription system of the ASJP project.

NAME: bdpa
DESCRIPTION: The data is taken from the *Benchmark database of phonetic alignments* ([List and Prokić 2014](:bib:List2014e)) which offers data on sound sequences in segmented form. The frequency counts reflect the number of varieties in the data for which a given segment could be found. Since the data contains many dialectal datasets, the frequency counts to not reflect general sound distributions but rather the frequency of sound segments in the data.

NAME: bdproto
DESCRIPTION: Transcription data assembled from the BDPROTO database, which offers phoneme inventories of proto-languages.

NAME: beidasinitic
DESCRIPTION: The inventories given in the Fāngyán Cíhuì (Beijing Daxue 1964).

NAME: bipa
DESCRIPTION: Broad version of IPA, understood as a reference for the other systems.

NAME: chomsky
DESCRIPTION: This is the feature system proposed by [Chomsky and Halle (1968)](:bib:Chomsky1968). The system is limited in so far as it only lists the sounds the scholars identify for English.

NAME: color
DESCRIPTION: A simple color-scheme based on Dolgopolsky's sound classes, used in LingPy.

NAME: cv
DESCRIPTION: Simple consonant-vowel-tone sound class model provided by LingPy (List et al. 2017).

NAME: diachronica
DESCRIPTION: The online version of the Index Diachronica, which is no longer available in its original form.

NAME: dolgo
DESCRIPTION: Sound class model (produced in a semi-geneative manner with help of LingPy) following Dolgopolsky (1964) as used in List (2014).

NAME: eurasian
DESCRIPTION: The data provided by the *Database of Eurasian Phonological Inventories*.

NAME: gld
DESCRIPTION: Transcription system of the Global Lexicostatistical Database project.

NAME: jipa
DESCRIPTION: Data from inventories published in the Journal of the International Phonetic Association (JIPA), as collected by Baird et al. (forth.)

NAME: lapsyd
DESCRIPTION: The data provided by the LAPSYD database.

NAME: multimedia
DESCRIPTION: The data presented on the Multimedia IPA Chart by the Department of Linguistics at University of Victoria.

NAME: napa
DESCRIPTION: A tentative reconstruction of what is known as the North-American Phonetic Alphabet. Our description is a compromise between different sources, especially Pullum and Ladusaw (1996), but also the information available in Wikipedia (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Americanist_phonetic_notation).

NAME: nidaba
DESCRIPTION: The data offered by the Nidaba web application.

NAME: panphon
DESCRIPTION: The PanPhon project offers a Python API to validate IPA segments and to compare them using an extended feature system. For our project, we link to the PanPhon data file which lists 6454 segments in its current version, some of which are described by the same features and therefore aliases in our definition.

NAME: pbase
DESCRIPTION: The data provided by the PBase project which was collected for the study of Mielke (2008).

NAME: phoible
DESCRIPTION: The data provided by the Phoible project.

NAME: ruhlen
DESCRIPTION: The data provided by the *Global Linguistic Database* (Ruhlen 2008) as it was prepared by Creanza et al. (2015).

NAME: sala
DESCRIPTION: The data provided by the *Systèmes alphabétiques des langues africaines* (Unesco-SIL 1993) as it was prepared by the LLACAN project.

NAME: saphon
DESCRIPTION: Transcription data assembled from the South American Phonological Inventory Database.

NAME: sca
DESCRIPTION: Sound class model (produced in a semi-generative manner with help of LingPy) following List (2014).

NAME: segbo
DESCRIPTION: Transcription data assembled for a study on the borrowing of phonological segment borrowing.

NAME: upa
DESCRIPTION: A transcription system is used predominantly for the transcription and reconstruction of Uralic languages.

NAME: wiki
DESCRIPTION: This data is taken from the Wikipedia description of the phonetic alphabet. We have the ambition to link to all pages on Wikipedia dedicated to specific sounds in the world's languages. For the moment, however, the data is likely to contain a lot of gaps.
